items.title: Referendum Update for Polkadot and Kusama Bridge Bounties  - New curation team
items.content:
**Track:** Treasury Big Spender

**Proposer:** VinceCorsica (14Pn8sUxdEMgFRDgZ5J2VfcUVMLaMQhst9XuvCj9mKJYUAN2)

**New Curator PureProxy:** Gdxia95Ti5REcK1MLjgg681cq3U9fKBvfRZdjKAZ9jwrrTR

**Controlling MultiSig:** Fk1ZmpYWsMMsKxf9Aj1GFAS4TeU34bud5KVP9ZUKLYvoC8r

**Date:  28th August 2025**
**Short description:  Updating Security Bridge Bounties Multisig membership**



***








The purpose of this referendum is to update the curators of the bounty.

A new PureProxy has been created for that purpose, and the curators membership has been amended to reinforce the focus on the different bridges. It is important to note that due to the minimum traffic on the K \<> P Bridge, no funds from the bounty have been spent so far. A new partnership with Hacken and the inclusion in the scope of the bounty of Snowbridge and Hyperbridge, as well as the change of curators to also reflect this change, will allow us to deliver on the increase of interest of reporters on Hacken platform. 



For more details about the scope and how this bounty works please check at [<u>https://polkadot.com/bridges-bug-bounty/</u>](https://polkadot.com/bridges-bug-bounty/).



Status of what has been delivered so far:



* In 2024, there has been limited traffic to the bridge so the level of attraction within the researcher community has been limited.
* Since Q1-2025 and thanks to an initial partnership with the Hacken Bounty platform and help from Distractive, the bounty has received increased attention from researchers ([<u>Hacken Portal</u>](https://hackenproof.com/programs/polkadot-bridge)) with +15000 scope reviews. 
* No bounties have been paid and no fees have been paid, all activities have been done pro bono by all stakeholders including curators and partners.



The next steps are:



* The new curator team aims to continue to improve things by:
  * Reinforcing the security partnership between bridges by expanding the scope to [<u>Snowbridge</u>](https://app.snowbridge.network/) and [<u>Hyperbridge</u>](https://app.hyperbridge.network/) especially in the context of the recent increase of traffic through the different bridges.
  * Reviewing the total reward amount available to reporters with the different scope adding funds to a consolidated reward pool
  * Reviewing the reward and fee structure for the different stakeholders
  * Reinforcing the [<u>visibility</u>](https://x.com/HackenProof/status/1895140859362120088) to attract more researchers at the different events, on social media and Bounty Platform
  * Partnering with other Bounties including [<u>Polkadot Assurance Legion.</u>](https://dotpal.io/)
* More details about the above will be shared to the community in September/October 2025 in the direction channels and on this post.



NOTE: A mirror referendum is happening in Polkadot as the Bounty is on both networks.



Curator changes:

* The security nested MSG was creating more operational complexity than specific added value so it is suppressed (it was requiring more coordination of people and in addition Multisig containing another Multisig is not supported in the same way by the different tools and as a consequence made on chain transactions more complicated to raise and sign).
* [<u>Jeroen</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/1ubpnuk7AwPwmEnuhxuv3f5pvwp8X1QdqcMucSwdDDehSGB) and [<u>Kirill</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/13zU1pipCuijDA1eWdHPnDgEHh3BvDJ9GsPMMFFvE5p6GF4D) are not part of this new set of curators, and we would like to take the opportunity to thank them for the initial phase of this bounty.
* As a consequence the new curators are 5 and not 7, aligned with the different bridges part of the scope.



Curators of the new MSG:

* [<u>Valery</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/15BERoWxrWC61cAb4JjpUdM7sy8FAS9uduismDbZ7PURZLto) - Cl0x (Hydration team)
* [<u>Vince</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/14Pn8sUxdEMgFRDgZ5J2VfcUVMLaMQhst9XuvCj9mKJYUAN2) - VinceCorsica (Parity’s Security)
* [<u>Adrian</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/121dd6J26VUnBZ8BqLGjANWkEAXSb9mWq1SB7LsS9QNTGFvz) - Kata (Parity Bridge team)
* [<u>Vincent</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/16YdterMH6axUsZP52fF3M7JJePfNB3yCd8dXwniEofpTSiP) - SnowBridge team
* [<u>Seun</u>](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/user/1333zsMafds2sKAr8nG3zwXTCHPYv2Nm6CRgakpu6YVGt7nM) - Hyperbridge team

items.title: Subscan 2025 Q1-Q2 Funding Proposal: Basic service fee for the Kusama Relaychain and Kusama public parachain (AssetHub, Coretime, BridgeHub, People)
items.content: ## **Subscan 2025 Q1-Q2 Funding Proposal: Basic service fee for the Kusama Relaychain and Kusama public parachain (AssetHub, Coretime, BridgeHub, People)** > *Due to potential display issues with some charts in markdown format across various devices and platforms, please refer to the detailed information in this Google Document:* > [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MdAecFs36pUq8lT-pkCW-P7LzSdEsShr\_k84ct4yQWs/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MdAecFs36pUq8lT-pkCW-P7LzSdEsShr_k84ct4yQWs/edit?usp=sharing) Subscan is one of the most widely used blockchain explorers and indexers in the Polkadot ecosystem. It serves developers, validators, parachain teams, governance participants, and the wider community with reliable, accurate, and comprehensive blockchain data. Our infrastructure underpins operational reliability, governance transparency, and cross-chain interoperability — playing an indispensable role in the growth and decision-making processes of the ecosystem. ### **Past proposals** * [#229 Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Kusama & Statemine (from July to December 2022)](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/229) * [#377 Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Kusama & Asset Hub (Kusama) Networks (from January 2023 to March 2024)](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/377) * [#434 Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Kusama & Statemine Networks (from April to June 2024)](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/434) * [#482 Subscan Q2/Q3/Q4 2024 Funding Proposal: Basic service fee for the Kusama Relaychain and Kusama public parachain (AssetHub, Coretime, BridgeHub, People)](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/482) ### ### **Overview and Rationale** Subscan has long served as a core data infrastructure provider within the Kusama ecosystem, delivering stable, accurate, and low-latency blockchain indexing and explorer services for the relay chain and multiple public parachains (AssetHub, Coretime, BridgeHub, People). Over the past several quarters, on-chain transaction volumes, event counts, and the number of parachains have all grown steadily. This has directly increased database storage requirements and API load. Whether it is developers debugging dApps, validators monitoring node health, or community members tracking governance and asset data, these services all rely on Subscan’s reliability and precision. For Q1–Q2 2025, our primary goals are: 1. **Ensure operational stability across 5 networks** — covering data collection, indexing, storage, and API services for the Kusama relay chain and four public parachains. 2. **Maintain data quality and performance** — ensuring indexing accuracy and query responsiveness despite continuous data growth. 3. **Support ecosystem expansion** — through ongoing improvements to the basic module, governance data coverage, and cross-chain data parsing capabilities. This proposal ensures the Kusama ecosystem continues to benefit from reliable and transparent data services, with costs tied directly to real usage metrics. ### **Scope of This Proposal** **Q1\&Q2 Maintenance (5 Networks)**: * **Relay Chain:** Kusama * **Public Parachains**: AssetHub, Coretime, BridgeHub, People These networks benefit from high-quality data indexing, stable uptime, accurate block and transaction data, NFT indexing improvements, and reliable APIs that developers and validators depend on daily. Worth explicitly stating and cross-referencing that this request covers maintenance only. Any development work for Kusama-specific features is provided at no additional cost, as the one-time development expenses have already been covered under the Polkadot proposal. Adapting existing functionality to the Kusama network requires minimal effort and therefore incurs **no extra charges**. ### **Benefits to Different User Groups** * **Developers**: The enhanced APIs and improved indexing accuracy allow developers to more quickly access real-time and historical data, enabling them to build more reliable dApps and automation tools. * **Validators & Parachain Teams**: Up-to-date block information, node health monitoring, and clear notification pipelines help validators maintain stable operations and quickly address issues. Parachain teams receive timely insights into network performance, asset transfers, and governance activities, facilitating better decision-making. * **End-Users & Traders**: Subscan’s improved UI/UX, faster data retrieval, and more accurate token pricing empower end-users to confidently explore and evaluate chain data. Improved NFT module performance enhances the experience for users and creators alike, making the platform more accessible and engaging. ### **Service Fee Model & Pricing Methodology** Our maintenance packages are designed to address a variety of data needs, ensuring smooth and efficient operations. Given the complexity of our overall cost structure—which includes expenses for GCP, Cloudflare, Datadog, Onfinality, Dwellir, and Subscan’s team operations—we use storage as the primary metric to determine fees. Storage usage strongly correlates with total costs and fluctuates as new blocks are produced. To maintain fairness and accuracy, we use the median storage value measured on the 15th day of each quarter to establish the quarterly baseline fee. **Pricing Tiers**: **a. Basic Plan** * Up to 200 GB: $799/month * Beyond 200 GB: $5.3/GB * Automatically upgrades to the next tier after 350 GB **b. Advanced Plan** * Up to 500 GB: $1,699/month * Beyond 500 GB: $5.2/GB * Automatically upgrades to the next tier after 750 GB **c. Professional Plan** * Up to 1 TB: $2,999/month * Beyond 1 TB: $5/GB ### **Monthly Service Fee Breakdown** 1. **Database Storage & Indexing** * **What It Covers**: Continuous indexing of on-chain data—from blocks and transactions to event logs, governance info, and NFTs—so users can reliably access both real-time and historical records. * **Why It Matters**: As chain activity increases, so does data volume. By tying fees to storage needs, we accurately account for the costs of scaling infrastructure (e.g., additional database capacity). 2. **Network Egress Bandwidth** * **What It Covers**: The outgoing traffic required to serve user requests quickly and consistently, including API calls, UI data retrieval, and integrations with third-party tools. * **Why It Matters**: A stable, high-bandwidth connection ensures that explorers, wallets, and dApps receive timely data responses, even during peak activity. 3. **Monitoring & DevOps** * **What It Covers**: Round-the-clock health checks, internal alert pipelines, CI/CD automation, and system auditing. This includes running multiple nodes, maintaining synchronization, and ensuring high availability. * **Why It Matters**: These processes help detect issues early (e.g., node crashes, indexer slowdowns) and streamline updates or deployments, minimizing service disruption for the community. 4. **Node Status Monitoring & Notifications** * **What It Covers**: Dedicated tools and alert mechanisms to track the real-time status of network nodes—particularly those relating to the Kusama Relay Chain and the associated parachains (Assethub, Coretime, Bridgehub, People). * **Why It Matters**: Quick notifications enable parachain teams, validators, and the wider ecosystem to react rapidly to performance changes, forks, or potential security incidents. 5. **Technical Support & Troubleshooting** * **What It Covers**: Responsive assistance for users, developers, and validators, including issue resolution, feature guidance, and integration help. * **Why It Matters**: Timely support keeps the ecosystem running smoothly and fosters a positive development environment—especially crucial for teams building dApps, explorers, and automation tools. ### **Why We Use Storage as a Pricing Metric** * **Correlation to Real Costs**: Storage growth scales in tandem with block production and transaction activity, making it a more stable metric than raw API traffic. * **Quarterly Baseline**: By measuring the median storage on the 15th day of each quarter, we capture a fair snapshot of usage to determine the appropriate fee tier. * **Predictable Billing**: This approach reduces wild fluctuations tied to sudden traffic spikes and provides a more transparent cost basis for the community and treasury. ### **Beyond Storage: The Full Cost Landscape** Our pricing also factors in overhead for hosting and operational services such as **GCP, Cloudflare, Datadog, Onfinality, Dwellir**, plus Subscan’s own team efforts in **maintenance, development, and user support**. By pegging fees to storage usage, we ensure a straightforward, usage-based cost structure while continuing to deliver reliable, feature-rich explorer services to the Kusama ecosystem. ### **Fee Details** #### **2025 Q1 & Q2 Maintenance Fee** #### #### #### | Network | Actual Usage/GB | Date | Package | Fees/Month | Billing Period | Fees | | ---------------- | --------------- | ---------- | ------------ | ---------- | ------------------------- | ----- | | Kusama | 3339.15 | 14/02/2025 | Professional | 14574 | Q1: 01/01/2025-31/03/2025 | 43724 | | Kusama | 3479.22 | 16/05/2025 | Professional | 15275 | Q2: 01/04/2025-30/06/2025 | 45825 | | AssetHub-Kusama | 291.4 | 14/02/2025 | Basic+ | 1283 | Q1: 01/01/2025-31/03/2025 | 3850 | | AssetHub-Kusama | 310.05 | 16/05/2025 | Basic+ | 1382 | Q2: 01/04/2025-30/06/2025 | 4146 | | Coretime-Kusama | 57.17 | 14/02/2025 | Basic | 799 | Q1: 01/01/2025-31/03/2025 | 2397 | | Coretime-Kusama | 67.87 | 16/05/2025 | Basic | 799 | Q2: 01/04/2025-30/06/2025 | 2397 | | BridgeHub-Kusama | 173.27 | 14/02/2025 | Basic | 799 | Q1: 01/01/2025-31/03/2025 | 2397 | | BridgeHub-Kusama | 207.33 | 16/05/2025 | Basic+ | 837 | Q2: 01/04/2025-30/06/2025 | 2513 | | People-Kusama | 44.79 | 14/02/2025 | Basic | 799 | Q1: 01/01/2025-31/03/2025 | 2397 | | People-Kusama | 61.36 | 16/05/2025 | Basic | 799 | Q2: 01/04/2025-30/06/2025 | 2397 | * Total Maintenance Fees for 2025 Q1 & Q2 (5 networks): USD 112,043 **Risk Assessment & Mitigation** * **Rising Storage Costs**: We employ automated data cleaning and indexing optimizations to prevent runaway growth. * **Security & Reliability**: Regular audits, real-time monitoring, and DevOps best practices minimize downtime and security threats. We remain responsive to any chain or protocol updates, ensuring compatibility and smooth operation. **Long-Term Sustainability & Vision** Our long-term goal is to reduce reliance on treasury funding through multiple channels: * Continuous optimization to limit infrastructure costs as chain data grows. * Exploring responsible revenue streams (e.g., optional premium features or partnerships). * Actively incorporating community suggestions to ensure value delivery aligns with user needs, increasing platform utility and potential monetization avenues without compromising openness or neutrality. ### **Total Requested Amount** **The total amount is 112,043. This request will be submitted in KSM, converted based on the 7-day average price at the time of on-chain submission.** [**https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/price\_converter?value=112043\&type=block\&from=USD\&to=KSM\&time=29767967\&page\_size=100\&page=1**](https://kusama.subscan.io/tools/price_converter?value=112043\&type=block\&from=USD\&to=KSM\&time=29767967\&page_size=100\&page=1) 2025-08-22 08:00:00 (+UTC), Block #29767967 KSM EMA7 Price ( USD ): 14.713949; Number of KSM: 7614.747067 **Conclusion** This proposal reflects our commitment to delivering stable, high-quality infrastructure and valuable features to the Kusama ecosystem. Through cost optimization, transparent reporting, continuous improvement, and a clear roadmap for future development, we strive to maintain the community’s trust and support. Our approach balances technical rigor, community engagement, and long-term sustainability—ensuring Subscan remains a cornerstone for the Kusama ecosystem’s data needs. A heartfelt thank-you to every one of our community members for the time, patience, and continuous feedback you’ve given. With your support, we can keep improving and make our community an even better place—together!

items.title: Stage 2: Drive massive adoption with the first 20,000 physical debit cards for LatAm people led by kusama (new 20,000 holders over 1 year)
items.content:
## Objective

Bloque aims to make Kusama the leading network for debit card issuance worldwide, starting in LatAm. Our success metric result for this project is $10M in monthly volume on Asset Hub. We have the network, the team, the metrics—and your trust.

## We are a trusted team

Our team we have shipped before the [#499](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/499) 30% faster with 20% more total payment volume in asset hub [(+$528K USD vs $440K USD )](https://assethub-kusama.subscan.io/account/CzQea4LtW8YWgwgYRMeRi64FgK2YVnWDGQkxa9SxcqPRq7W?tab=asset_change)


## Summary proposal.

**Bloque** has  launched an  open developer platform to issue layer 1 VISA  debit  cards on Kusama Asset Hub.

The requested funding allows us to build on the technical foundation to issue and distribute 20,000 physical debit cards over <ins>1 year</ins> to 20,000 new and KYC’d Kusama account holders. These new cards have its own account in Asset-hub and can spend KSM, dUSD and native tokens at any point of sale. instantly.

These new users will be onboarded through  trusted partners including: fintech platforms, construction companies, e-commerce merchants and street sellers throughout LatAm. 

We project an average spend per card of $149 - $500 per month creating a monthly volume of $3.6M to $10m, we already moved ~~$440K~~ $528K USD on-chain in AH. (Why 500 USD, check the FAQ below)

This will generate 0.2% fees on every transaction for Kusama - $7.2K - $20k per month. 

For developers you can issue debit cards to your users and earn up to 1.2% on every purchase they make. It’s a cost-effective, compliant, and growth aligned  way to boost your revenue while delivering real value to your community.

## Why Kusama?

- Kusama its a production ready blockchain underuse that is 8.22x cheaper:

**Pure Proxy:** Kusama(0.0068 KSM) ~= 0.0941 USD vs Polkadot(0.2 DOT) > ~0.7 USD
- Kusama receives faster upgrades, we benefit sooner from performance, security, scalability and Governance.
- We made the first Kusama/Polkadot Meetup in LatAm in my previous startup Valiu, in 2020, i'm a true believer.

## KYC/KYB Not required for DAOS

We’re building a legal framework that lets communities and individuals use debit cards without exposing personal identity. Our KYT‑driven compliance program reduces AML risks and allows DAOs and their members to access the traditional financial system while preserving privacy.

## ZK Approach

We aim to enable ZK proofs in a later phase. Our manufacturer supports loading Java applets onto the card, enabling on‑card cryptography. We’re evaluating how to leverage this for privacy‑preserving verification, once we got confirmation we can share a plan with the community.

## Demo
[![](https://i.postimg.cc/qqLcFk8k/Screenshot-2025-07-24-at-1-59-54-PM.png)](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/mrfdBTdszSk)

## AGG presentation
[![](https://i.postimg.cc/yY1kPhW4/Screenshot-2025-07-24-at-1-51-15-PM.png)](https://x.com/TheKusamarian/status/1948171274305544209)
[Link to slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1zwY2wvwEJe74sSJnKGwI46vBdeIumZody3Tax6VNyY0/edit?slide=id.g3634ddf2cff_0_102#slide=id.g3634ddf2cff_0_102)

## TL; DR;

**Our team:**

- Founding team from YCombinator.
-  $2.5m USD Total Payment Volume to date.
- +$400k USD on moved on Kusama AH currently.
- Delivered the [#499 30% faster](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/499).

**Proposal:**
-  Expected $3.6 - $10m USD monthly volume in AH through 20,000 holders spending +$149-$500 per month. 
- Our north-star success metric is $10M USD in monthly volume.
- 0.2% Transaction fees to Kusama (either burned or $7.2-$20k USD per month to treasury) 
- buy pressure with 0.1% purchase per debit card transaction in KSM for fees.
- Developers can earn up to 1.2% of transaction fees by launching their own branded cards 
- Opportunity for branding on the card, which lead awareness of kusama. 
- Costs are for purchasing debit cards and for developer time.
- Risk shared by Bloque team who are covering their own overhead (~$134K USD paid by Bloque,  $179K paid by Kusama).

## Costs:

#### Physical Card  Costs (107,707 USD) paid by Kusama : 60.1% of total Amount.
- **Price per card:**3.04 USD x 20,000 = +60,800 USD [(You can check it in our contract here)](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z2tmUvMkL-3Te4HhPEyCPBZG719KTgpA/view)
-** Embossing fee:**+4,500 USD
- **Colombian VAT:** 19% = 0.19  * (60,800 USD + 4,500 USD) = +12,407 USD
- **Additional Visa Collateral:** +30K USD extra collateral for Visa processing transactions ahead of settlement. (Global)

 #### Engineering Time Costs (72,000 USD) paid by Kusama: 39.9% Total Amount.
- **Team Composition:** The project will employ 2 full-time mid engineers, to improve concurrency, security and UX/UI for the debit card platform.
- **Monthly Cost:** Each member incurs a cost of 3K USD per month.
- **Project Duration:** The team will work full-time for a period of 12 months.
- Multiplying the monthly cost by the number of team members and the duration (3K USD x 2 members x 12 months).

#### Operative team (Compliance, head finance, Infrastructure) paid by Bloque: ~134,760 USD
- **Team composition:** Head of Sales, Compliance Officer & Head of Financial operations + devops and Infrastructure. 
- **Monthly costs:** 11.230,51 USD
- **Duration:** 12 Months

## Resources
- [Full proposal document.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EKVbKmIPMnd0M52wUYr2VRd3un7hXfe8rozCU6PRY2M/edit?usp=sharing)
- API docs: [Authentication + Holder Creation](https://api.bloque.app/docs/origins), [Transactional Ledger](https://api.bloque.app/docs/ledger), [Card issuance](https://api.bloque.app/docs/mediums).

## FAQ
**Which regions are supported?** Mainly LatAm starting in Colombia & Mexico with worldwide availability via Passport.

**How will this API handle key material since the wallets are non-custodial?**
We use a combination of proxy accounts with defined spending limits. In addition, the “debit callback” endpoint with 3D Secure prompts users to authorize (i.e., sign) transactions—effectively meaning the user “sells” crypto to us so that we can complete the payment on their behalf. Our security model is based on Shamir’s Secret Sharing: at setup, the holder sends us one part of the secret while keeping the other part secure across multiple devices. When a transaction is authorized, the two parts are combined to complete the transaction.

**How are redemptions processed?**
Today’s redemption channels include Brale Rails (conversion across 10+ chains to USDT/USDC), a DEX liquidity pool for KSM/dUSD, and direct debit card transactions.

**Do day-to-day COP inflation swings pose a risk?**
Yes, they can. To mitigate this risk, we maintain only small COP buffers in the bank while holding most of our treasury in USD.

**How will the system mitigate potential volatility given that settlement can take several days?**
Limiting USD buffer sales to twice daily (e.g., morning and afternoon) may expose us to unexpected volatility. Ideally, we offload USD as frequently as market conditions allow. When that isn’t feasible, we rely on compensation accounts, short-term COP buffer loans, SWIFT transfers, and OTC channels to quickly convert USD into COP liquidity.

**How would a chargeback or clawback be handled?**
For same-day chargebacks—such as paying $5 with KSM for an Uber ride and then canceling—the system applies an adjustment credit by deducting $5 from the USD buffer, converting it to KSM, and crediting your account. For delayed clawbacks—like purchasing a $20 card with KSM on Temu but receiving a faulty product—we detect the issue via Visa’s invoices and balance sheets. In the next payment cycle, we net the amounts between our accounts; for instance, if we owe Visa $100 but receive $20, we pay only $80, converting the extra $20 into KSM and crediting your account.

**Why 20,000 cards instead of 10,000 or 5,000?**
Pomelo minimum order is 10K physical cards,  For the range of 10K or 20K, our operative costs are the same, the unit costs operative cost per card is lower for 20K cards, so its optimal for RoI.

For 20K Cards = (134,760 + 72,000)/20,000 cards =  ~$10 USD.
For 10K Cards = (134,760 + 72,000)/10,000 card = ~$20 USD.

**Why $149 - $500 USD per card?**
[Please check our volumes projection](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qhy7ncYhbg5JCBA2FF4gWPu19VunMzIF_-nLyqIodq4/edit?gid=735485583#gid=735485583)

items.title: PolkArena: Revolutionizing Events for the Polkadot Era
items.content:
# **PolkArena: Revolutionizing Events for the Polkadot Era**

## **Summary**

We propose to develop a comprehensive universal events portal specifically designed for the Polkadot ecosystem, serving as the decentralized amalgamation of Luma and DoraHacks while introducing unique on-chain features that will revolutionize how events/hackathons are conducted! This platform will fulfil the complete spectrum of event needs - from simple community meetups and networking sessions to sophisticated multi-track hackathons with integrated judging, funding, and project submission systems. By combining the user-friendly interface and broad appeal of mainstream event platforms with unique web3-native features, PolkArena will revolutionize how events are conducted and experienced.

The platform will serve as the premier destination for all Polkadot ecosystem participants - event attendees, organizers, developers, investors, and community members. Unlike traditional centralized platforms that charge significant fees (Luma charges 5% platform fees for paid events) and lack transparency, PolkArena will leverage Polkadot's infrastructure to provide unprecedented transparency, immutable records, utilisation of Polkadot-exclusive features and no-cost event management tools for Polkadot contributors and all the attendees of the ecosystem events.

### **Why Kusama?**

As we develop the PolkArena in phases, we will be aiming to roll out the miniature event hosting portal first which will run on Kusama AssetHub’s PolkaVM, ready to use for the small scale meetups and non-hackathon events, way before the whole development scope is achieved.

## **Project Overview**

### **Vision**

Building on our experience hosting the [AssetHub Hackathon](https://lu.ma/PolkaVM?period=past), we ([Edgetributor SubDAO](https://x.com/Edgetributors/) and [MontaQ Labs](https://x.com/montaqlabs)) identified the critical need for a unified, web3-native events platform that could handle everything from casual community gatherings to complex multi-day hackathons with sophisticated judging mechanisms and on-chain funding distribution.

The aim is to create the most advanced blockchain-native universal events platform that seamlessly integrates with Polkadot's infrastructure, serving as the decentralized equivalent of Luma while incorporating DoraHacks' sophisticated hackathon capabilities, especially the capabilities often missing from fragmented event management across different platforms.

### **Core Value Proposition**

Unlike traditional event platforms such as Luma (which offers basic event management with limited blockchain integration) or specialized hackathon platforms like DoraHacks (which focuses primarily on developer competitions), PolkArena will be the first platform to combine universal event management capabilities with deep blockchain integrations. Our solution will store critical event data on-chain on PolkaVM, provide native Polkadot tooling integration, and offer features specifically tailored to serve both the technical and non-technical members of the Polkadot community.
Even competitor ecosystems lack such comprehensive on-chain event infrastructure. For example, while Solana has the Colosseum platform for hackathons, it lacks web3-native features and universal event management capabilities.

### **Ecosystem Benefits**

* **Universal Event Portal:** From 10-person meetups to 1000+ participant hackathons
* **Blockchain-native Architecture:** Built on PolkaVM for enhanced performance
* **Developer Onboarding**: Streamlined entry point for new Polkadot developers
* **Innovation Catalyst**: Platform for showcasing cutting-edge Polkadot capabilities
* **Community Growth**: Enhanced engagement through gamification and social features
* **Talent Hub**: Go to place for talent identification, development, and ecosystem onboarding by anyone

## **Feature Set**

### **Unique Core Features:**

* **On-Chain Data Storage**
  * Event/hackathon details, configurations, and metadata stored immutably on-chain
  * Registrations and check-ins
  * Hackathon project submissions with cryptographic proof of timing and authenticity
  * Participant feedback and judging scores with transparent tracking
  * Complete project changelog history with version control on-chain
  * Live scoring tracker with real-time updates and dispute resolution
* **StorageHub Integration**
  * Seamless project video and source code storage when StorageHub launches
  * Decentralized file management with content addressing
  * Automatic backup and versioning of project assets
* **Developer Experience Tools**
  * 1-click local pre-configured devnet deployment using chopsticks for rapid prototyping
  * Chain state snapshot functionality for testing and development (tentative)
  * Universal faucet integration supporting all Polkadot parachains
* **Gamification & Learning**
  * On-chain quizzes with verifiable completion certificates as NFTs
  * Task-based leaderboards with skill progression tracking
  * Side quests and assignments with automated validation
  * Achievement NFT system for skill milestones
* **Advanced Reward System**
  * Native DOT distribution with programmable vesting
  * Multi-token support (ERC20/ERC721/ERC1155) for diverse reward structures
  * Automated prize distribution based on smart contract conditions
  * Cross-chain reward compatibility through XCM
* **Social & Collaboration Features**
  * Grill Chat integration for decentralized communication
  * AI-powered team matching based on complementary skills
  * Mentor network with reputation-based matching
  * Real-time collaboration tools with on-chain coordination
* **Event Management**
  * Integrated calendar with Luma API for seamless event scheduling
  * Side event coordination with automatic notifications
  * Cross-platform event synchronization
  * Community-driven event discovery
* **Recognition & Credentials**
  * dotMemo integration for proof of attendance
  * Skill-based achievement system with verifiable credentials
  * Portfolio generation with project showcase capabilities
  * Community reputation scoring with on-chain verification

### **Additional Features:**

* **Advanced Analytics Dashboard**
  * Real-time participation metrics and engagement tracking
  * Project quality assessment with AI-powered insights
  * Ecosystem health monitoring and trend analysis
  * Predictive analytics for hackathon success factors
* **Cross-Chain Compatibility**
  * Seamless integration with other Substrate-based chains
  * Cross-parachain project deployment capabilities
  * Universal identity management across the ecosystem
* **Enterprise Integration**
  * Corporate sponsor dashboards with detailed ROI tracking
  * Advanced filtering and search capabilities for talent recruitment
  * Automated compliance reporting and audit trails
  * Custom branding and white-label solutions
* **AI-Powered Features**
  * Intelligent project categorization and tagging
  * Automated code quality assessment and feedback
  * Smart matching algorithms for optimal team formation
  * Predictive prize allocation recommendations

### **Technical Architecture:**

The platform will be built using a modular architecture that leverages Polkadot ecosystem's unique capabilities while ensuring scalability and maintainability. Core components include:

* **Smart Contract Layer**: PolkaVM contracts for complex business logic
* **Storage Layer**: Hybrid approach using on-chain and StorageHub storage
* **Integration Layer**: APIs for seamless third-party integrations
* **Frontend**: Modern React/Nextjs-based interface with Web3 wallet integration

## **Development Phases**

### **Phase 1: Core Platform Foundation (320 hours - $19,200)**

**Duration**: 18 working days

* Basic hackathon portal infrastructure development
* User authentication system with Web3 wallet integration
* Hackathon creation and management interface
* Basic project submission system
* Foundation admin dashboard with essential controls

### **Phase 2: Social & Integration Features (280 hours - $16,800)**

**Duration**: 16 working days

* Grill Chat integration for decentralized communication
* Calendar system with Luma API integration
* Side event management with automated coordination
* dotMemo integration for proof of attendance

### **Phase 3: On-chain Integration & Storage (330 hours - $19,800)**

**Duration**: 19 working days

* Smart contract development for core platform logic
* On-chain storage implementation for hackathon details and configurations
* Blockchain integration layer with Polkadot SDK
* On-chain project submission system
* User feedback and rating system with immutable records

### **Phase 4: Advanced Features & Tools (240 hours - $14,400)**

**Duration**: 14 working days

* 1-click local devnet deployment functionality
* Universal faucet integration with multi-parachain support
* Leaderboard implementation with real-time updates

### **Phase 5: Scoring & Rewards System (225 hours - $13,500)**

**Duration**: 13 working days

* Live scoring tracker with transparent judging interface
* On-chain score storage with tie-breaker round(s)
* Automated DOT and multi-token reward distribution system
* NFT reward system supporting ERC721/ERC1155 standards
* On-chain check-in system with attendance verification
* AI based code quality checker and Plagiarism checker to help judges

### **Phase 6: StorageHub & Advanced Storage (160 hours - $9,600)**

**Duration**: 9 working days

* StorageHub integration framework preparation
* Source code storage system with version control
* Project changelog tracking with comprehensive history
* Advanced file management with content addressing

### **Phase 7: Testing, Documentation & Launch (140 hours - $8,400)**

**Duration**: 8 working days

* Comprehensive testing suite including unit, integration, and end-to-end tests wherever required
* Security audit and vulnerability assessment
* Complete documentation including developer guides and tutorials
* Community onboarding tools and educational resources
* Production deployment with monitoring and alerting systems

### **Maintenance: (360 hours across a year - $23,600)**

**Duration**: 12 months

Storage costs (StorageHub/IPFS), instance costs, domain cost and unforeseen expenses: \~ 2000 USD

Maintenance hours: 30 per month

**Total Maintenance for 1 year =** \[{(30 hours \* 60$ per hour) \* 12months} + 2000] = 23600 USD

## **Budget Summary**

**Total Development Hours**: 1695 hours
**Development budget:** 101700 USD

**Full-Time Equivalent (FTE):** 3.09
**Contributors involved:** 8 (6 from Edgetributor SubDAO + 2 from MontaQ Labs)

**Total Maintenance hours for 12 months:** 360 hours
**Total Maintenance cost for 12 months:** 23600 USD

**Total Budget**: **125300 USD**
**Total Timeline:** 4-5 months (96 working days)

### **Multisig details**

**Address:** GoPvcf5ZGCkXDejHarXszX1hD1fM5bDmiXDKH6JwAciq2wn
**Threshold**: 4/6

## **About MontaQ Labs and Edgetributor SubDAO**

MontaQ Labs is an organization dedicated to advancing the future of Web3 technology across the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region. The company operates under the motto "Ideas. Code. Impact" and focuses on fostering innovation through open-source development, community-driven education, and practical tool creation.

Edgetributor SubDAO is a collective of active solo contributors from the Edgeware DAO, one of the oldest substrate projects from the Polkadot ecosystem. Edgetributor SubDAO is currently the maintainer of the treasury-funded Universal Hybrid Substrate Faucet. The SubDAO members bring 3-4 years of Polkadot/Substrate ecosystem experience and expertise from different domains.
Edgetributor SubDAO also curated OpenGov/bounty proposals like development/audit of Paul Miller’s sr25519 package, as well as projects such as Rarible, Studio 54, SolidityScan, etc.
Pioneered Polkadot’s presence in India by successfully representing Polkadot at ETHIndia 2024, hosted the beloved AssetHub Hackathon, Polkadot India IIT Roorkee workshops series, Polkadot India IIT Bombay workshops series, partnered with Pala Labs for volunteering in JAM Tour Mumbai & JAM Tour HongKong.
We Build, We Curate & We Educate!

## **Conclusion**

The PolkArena represents a transformative opportunity to create the most advanced blockchain-native universal events platform which will subliminally capture mindshare for Kusama in all the Polkadot events. By combining proven event management functionalities with innovative on-chain features, we will deliver a platform that serves as the go-to destination for all types of events within the Polkadot community, from simple meetups to complex hackathons.

This development will yield benefits through increased developer adoption especially on Kusama AssetHub, enhanced community engagement in a more structured/unified format, broader event analysis/accessibility/management for hosts of Polkadot events, and more seamless onchain activations.

items.title: Kusama Data on Dune+BigQuery (9 months, 7/1/25-3/31/26)
items.content:
Colorful Notion successfully onboarded the Polkadot ecosystem into Dune under [OpenGov 366](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/366), which has been operational for over one year now, and showcases the majority of the Polkadot ecosystem.  Colorful Notion wishes to renew its efforts to cover 3 additional quarters (Q3 2025 - Q1 2026), to ensure that Polkadot continues to be ingested and maintained on Dune as well as Google Cloud BigQuery (GC Web3). 

You can see much of our work in the **Highlighted Tweets** below, as well as in on the [Polkadot wiki](https://wiki.polkadot.network/general/dashboards/dune-analytics/).  

Full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dLbwJvhZ4IYIh0gQT-5D63uc5NzCLDWMr3jbEOUtCFI/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.v6is2ta0txr1) 
Full cost model [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1c7-3kdfAjWdtWTkx2anEQgYpToUiWo3vav1WrapFuEI/edit?gid=1499045302#gid=1499045302)

Note that we split the costs 5/6 on Polkadot ($609K in USDC, [https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/1642)](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/1642\)) and 1/6 on Kusama (9055 KSM, this ref).

**Because Kusama is anticipated to have a significant injection of up to 10MM DOT with a new roadmap, we felt it important to continue to support Kusama on its new roadmap.**   

Whereas the previous 12-18 months focussed on the heavy workload of onboarding the relay chain, system chains, all Polkadot parachains, the next 9 months will be more  focussed on the key migration of both the Kusama and Polkadot relay chains into Kusama Hub and Polkadot Hub thereafter and primarily supporting Polkadot Hub and the top 12 parachains active in the Polkadot ecosystem.

We aim to showcase our work in the remainder of 2025 and early 2026 in the same way we did in 2024.  *We hope that a new Kusama roadmap will enable us to showcase it in new ways in 2025 going into 2026.*

If you wish to see us do new things, we are eager to take on the challenge and help your Polkadot project shine in a on-chain data-driven way -- let us know your requests in the comments below and we will attempt to accommodate them.

We thank OpenGov voters past and present for enabling us to work in the Polkadot+Kusama ecosystems.

## TL;DR – 24 Months of Thirdweb Infrastructure Support for Kusama Asset Hub (EVM)

This proposal seeks **$50,600 USD (~3981 KSM)** to fund **24 months of full integration and support** of **thirdweb’s production-grade developer infrastructure** for the **Kusama Asset Hub EVM**. Delivered by **thirdweb in collaboration with DeStore**, this package unlocks powerful tools used by over **90,000+ developers** worldwide, including teams from **Coinbase**, **Shopify**, and **OP Superchain**.

## [Link to full Proposal ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JZ4Ruk4B9p38-l7wrp9Al_-nE8eIEF5YR4kdhJ4HysE/edit?usp=sharing)

### 🔧 What Developers Get:
A full suite of modular, open-source tools ready to be used by all developers on Kusama:

- **Connect** – Wallet integration with support for 500+ wallets, social logins, passkeys & gasless UX (ERC-4337 smart wallets)
- **Universal Bridge** – On-ramp users with debit cards or cross-chain crypto; devs earn per transaction
- **Engine** – Backend execution for contract deployment, airdrops, minting, and more
- **Contracts** – A library and deployment system for secure, pre-built and custom smart contracts
- **Insight** – Onchain indexing and custom API endpoints for NFTs, wallets, tokens, events, etc.
- **Nebula** – AI agent with live/historical blockchain access, capable of autonomous transactions
- **RPC Edge** – Reliable, globally distributed RPC layer with 99.9% uptime
- **Account Abstraction Stack** – Smart accounts, session keys, paymasters, batched transactions
- **SDKs & APIs** – Cross-platform tools for JS/TS, Unity, Python, and mobile apps
- **Enterprise Support** – Dedicated Slack channel, tailored training for Kusama ecosystem, and <24hr SLAs

### ⚡ Why It Matters:
This proposal directly supports **Referendum 498** and Kusama's evolution into a **sovereign innovation layer** backed by **10 million DOT**. Integrating Thirdweb’s battle-tested stack:

- 🌱 Boosts **ecosystem growth** and simplifies dev onboarding
- 🧠 Enables **AI, gaming, and advanced dApps** with minimal friction
- 🔗 Makes **Kusama Asset Hub** the most developer-friendly EVM in the Polkadot ecosystem

✅ **Vote Aye** to bring battle-proven Web3 tools to Kusama and unlock a wave of innovation.

items.title: DotShield - Take back control of your community
items.content:
Introducing DotShield, a Web3-native bot designed to improve moderation, verification, and scam prevention in Telegram and Discord communities within the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem.

Currently, existing Telegram bots lack customizable Web3 verification, relying instead on captchas that are easily bypassed. While some Discord bots support Web3 verification, there is no Polkadot-native solution.

DotShield solves this problem by enabling dynamic chain state verification, allowing groups to set their own desired criteria, such as balance thresholds and membership conditions, including but not limited to council membership, validator and other on-chain attributes.


**Why This Matters**
- Telegram & Discord groups are primary communication hubs for Web3 communities but suffer from spam, bot invasions, and scam attempts.
- Existing bots do not use cryptographic verification for users, meaning scam bots can easily bypass security measures.
- No Polkadot-native bot exists that integrates with the ecosystem for seamless verification.
- Expanding DotShield ensures better security, community discussions, and fraud prevention across the entire Polkadot ecosystem.


**The Story Behind DotShield**
I've been a moderator/admin of several Telegram group chats and have been searching for an effective solution to combat spam and bot invasions for years. Existing solutions, such as Rose and Shieldy, rely on traditional Web2 captchas, which are no longer effective. Frustrated with the lack of viable options, I decided to teach myself how to code and build my own solution. After countless all-nighters debugging and researching, I finally created DotShield—designed specifically to meet the needs of the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem.


**Core Features**
- **Dynamic Chain State Verification**: Group admins can set criteria based on on-chain balances, governance roles, or other identity markers.
- **Single Sign-In for Web3 Users**: No need to constantly sign transactions; DotShield seamlessly verifies users if they save their wallet as default.
- **Flexible Moderation**: Admins can override verification, allowing them to manually add or remove members.
- **Scam Prevention & Fraud Mitigation**: Dotshield is capable of implementing automated detection, user reporting mechanisms, and external scam database collaboration.
- **Expansion to Discord**: Addresses the lack of a Polkadot-native verification bot for Discord, ensuring Web3 security across both platforms.


**Funding Request & Milestone-Based Payment Structure**
I am requesting treasury funding to support both the initial deployment and expansion to Discord. Payments will be structured as follows:

1. **First Instalment** – Covers completed milestones (Telegram bot, core verification, UI, performance upgrades). **Total hours: 460**
2. **Second Instalment** – After successful completion of Discord expansion and verification. **Total projected hours: 470**

**Total hours: 930**

I am seeking **USD$60/hr** to cover:
- Development Server & Infrastructure Costs
- Ongoing Maintenance & Feature Requests
- Security & Scam Prevention Enhancements

[**Full Proposal**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1T30qpqw9mudbWZ9Y1Pr-jAs8hNblQiEFlSYhzlmKKeg/edit?tab=t.0)

**Feedback**
I’d love to hear your thoughts on how DotShield can be improved, whether additional features should be included, or if the funding structure needs adjustment.

**Here’s a summary of recent user feedback**:
- **Average Overall UX Rating**: 8.8 / 10
- **Average UI Satisfaction (DotShield.app)**: 8.9 / 10
- **Average Ease of Understanding Instructions**: 9.1 / 10
- **Common Bug Reports**:
Minimal bugs reported. Some mentioned minor onboarding issues, such as unclear steps for setting up a supergroup.

- **Comfort Linking Wallets**:
While some users expressed initial skepticism about connecting wallets (due to common web3 security concerns), many gained confidence thanks to positive community reputation.

- **Transparency Requests**:
Users would like clearer communication about how DotShield handles data, including open-sourcing certain elements or publishing technical documentation to build further trust.

- **Recommendation Likelihood**:
The majority of respondents would recommend DotShield to others, citing the value in protecting Polkadot ecosystem communities from scams and spam.

- **Improvement Suggestions**:
- Provide more detailed onboarding guides and user-facing documentation
- Increase transparency around wallet connection and data handling
- Enhance first-time user experience, especially for non-technical audiences

- **Polkadot Ecosystem Adoption**:
Users are highly supportive of DotShield becoming a standard security layer across Telegram and Discord for the Polkadot ecosystem.

- **Likelihood to share with other community managers**:
Average score of 8.1 / 10

https://t.me/Polkadot_Sign_Only

items.title: Funding for Public RPC Providers via Bounty 25
items.content:
Dear community,

I present this proposal on the authorization of the curators of bounty 25.

This proposal seeks to continue funding of Public RPC Providers for the period of six months plus an additional month's contingency. Funding is issued to bounty 25 which awards vendors for RPC services on the Kusama relay-chain as well as its system parachains. The total cost for such provision is USD$107,237.98, which represents $12,397.21 per month without contingency and administrative fees.

Bounty 25 adopts an tender based procurement model in which service providers bid on requirements as set-out by the curators. The tender requirements are aligned to ecosystem needs and can scale up/down depending on usage. Tenders are scored and the highest scoring providers receive funding.  
  
Attention is also being placed on quality of service and should service providers fail to meet said quality-standards they will be penalized or lose funding altogether.

This approach has seen a reduction with independent funding proposals for such services and steering of providers to a "market rate".

Further details can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WV7n5HVKtO5s0ub6g4uEQAN4Y7SRNcu56QYFXPgN15I/edit?tab=t.0)

Kind Regards,  
Will | Paradox | ParaNodes.io

items.title: Empower businesses to launch debit cards and store their value in Kusama.
items.content:
## Summary

Bloque offers an open API infrastructure that allows developers to easily integrate prepaid debit card functionality into their platforms, with balances securely stored on Kusama’s blockchain. Targeting financial exclusion in Latin America—where 25% of the population is unbanked—Bloque eliminates the costly barriers, regulatory challenges, and technical difficulties typically associated with issuing debit cards. Unlike standalone wallets, Bloque serves as infrastructure for businesses, enabling them to provide branded, non-custodial debit cards that users can load with stablecoins, use via mobile wallets or physical cards, and even withdraw cash worldwide. This approach not only promotes financial inclusion but also increases Kusama’s blockchain activity, as each transaction generates on-chain fees in KSM.  
  
  

### We're different

![](https://i.ibb.co/1w1JCRb/Bloque-Pitch-deck-6.png)

## TL; DR;

[![](https://i.ibb.co/nMLC54XG/Screenshot-2025-02-17-at-15-15-39.png)](https://www.youtube.com/live/kBX1RXwROy8?si=G1T9ymPBgJIUZ7Tf&t=454)

## Resources

-   Full proposal [document.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1J98P2-shkrODJEnFinJkDoVEN-JviygWfIocRo7l7ag/edit?tab=t.0)
-   [Website.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1J98P2-shkrODJEnFinJkDoVEN-JviygWfIocRo7l7ag/edit?tab=t.0)
-   First customer [Coco Wallet YCS19](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/coco-wallet) and [letter of intent for 450K and 3,500 Users.](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yOyvpNZvc043MvF61o6oppkY9rJ0gsqB/view?usp=sharing)
-   Contract with Visa & Pomelo to issue debit cards, bank statements, please request via DM in @david:bloque.team in Element.
-   Preview [API Documentation.](https://api.bloque.app/docs/accounts)

### How it works

![](https://i.ibb.co/CKsh6Y4F/diagram-export-2-17-2025-2-58-28-PM.png)

### Partners

-   **Pomelo + Visa (Debit card issuer):** Pomelo is a pioneering fintech transforming card issuance in Latin America. Its cloud-native, API-driven platform lets banks and fintechs launch secure, scalable cards rapidly. Partnering with Mastercard and Coastal Community Bank, Pomelo modernizes payments and drives financial inclusion.
-   **Truora (KYC/KYB):** Truora is a Latin American startup simplifying user verification and fraud prevention. Its API-driven platform offers background checks, digital identity, and KYC tools to help businesses onboard customers securely, reduce fraud, and boost conversion
-   **Bancolombia (Our Bank):** Bancolombia is Colombia’s largest bank, boasting 146+ years of trusted service. With 30M+ customers, extensive branch and ATM networks, and innovative digital solutions, it drives financial inclusion, supports sustainable growth, and champions economic progress across Latin America.

### Meet our first customer

[![](https://i.ibb.co/sd0gp7sF/Screenshot-2025-02-25-at-17-02-55.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzP1vXJq7zQ&t=2714s&ab_channel=TheKus)

we introduced CocoWallet, building on the success of [CocoMercado](https://www.cocomercado.com/landing/), a remittance-based food service that’s supported Venezuela’s elderly through 7,000,000 expats. Now, CocoWallet is tackling financial exclusion in Colombia by launching debit cards with Bloque for the unbanked—and we’re bringing this to Kusama.

Our goal is to onboard 3,000+ unbanked Colombians in the next few months. Here’s how we’ll do it on Kusama:

-   **Decentralized Design:** Funds will be held in non-custodial wallets on Kusama’s Asset-Hub, with all debit card transactions pay fees in KSM. No banks, no centralized control—just user-owned value.
-   **Kusama Benefits:** These 3,000 new users will become KSM holders, boosting adoption. Each card swipe will generate on-chain micro-transactions, increasing network activity and rewarding validators.
-   **Scalability:** After this pilot, we’ll scale to 10,000 users across Latin America by 2025, funded by transaction fees but no endless treasury asks. Banks are obsolete. We want to drive a transformation that enables every organization to provide financial services—starting with a debit card. We aim to free finances for people, and to do this, we need your support.

# FAQ

-   **Why funding us?** We are an experienced team with a proven record of building Web3 products. Now, we want to use Kusama in everyday cases worldwide.
    
-   **Which regions are supported?** Mainly LatAm starting in Colombia & Mexico with worldwide availability via Passport.
    
-   **How will this API handle key material since the wallets are non-custodial?**  
    We use a combination of proxy accounts with defined spending limits. In addition, the “debit callback” endpoint with 3D Secure prompts users to authorize (i.e., sign) transactions—effectively meaning the user “sells” crypto to us so that we can complete the payment on their behalf. Our security model is based on Shamir’s Secret Sharing: at setup, the holder sends us one part of the secret while keeping the other part secure across multiple devices. When a transaction is authorized, the two parts are combined to complete the transaction.
    
-   **How are redemptions processed?**  
    Today’s redemption channels include Brale Rails (conversion across 10+ chains to USDT/USDC), a DEX liquidity pool for KSM/dUSD, and direct debit card transactions.
    
-   **Do day-to-day COP inflation swings pose a risk?**  
    Yes, they can. To mitigate this risk, we maintain only small COP buffers in the bank while holding most of our treasury in USD.
    
-   **How will the system mitigate potential volatility given that settlement can take several days?**  
    Limiting USD buffer sales to twice daily (e.g., morning and afternoon) may expose us to unexpected volatility. Ideally, we offload USD as frequently as market conditions allow. When that isn’t feasible, we rely on compensation accounts, short-term COP buffer loans, SWIFT transfers, and OTC channels to quickly convert USD into COP liquidity.
    
-   **How would a chargeback or clawback be handled?**  
    **_For same-day chargebacks_**—such as paying $5 with KSM for an Uber ride and then canceling—the system applies an adjustment credit by deducting $5 from the USD buffer, converting it to KSM, and crediting your account. **_For delayed clawbacks_**—like purchasing a $20 card with KSM on Temu but receiving a faulty product—we detect the issue via Visa’s invoices and balance sheets. In the next payment cycle, we net the amounts between our accounts; for instance, if we owe Visa $100 but receive $20, we pay only $80, converting the extra $20 into KSM and crediting your account.
    
-   **Whats the relationship with Virto?** BloqueDAO is a Virto-spinoff established as a self-governing DAO in Kreivo. We’re leveraging on the Kreivo technology to support non-custodial management of the funds every user tops-up in their Kusama Pay cards.

-   **Truora (KYC/KYB):** Truora is a Latin American startup simplifying user verification and fraud prevention. Its API-driven platform offers background checks, digital identity, and KYC tools to help businesses onboard customers securely, reduce fraud, and boost conversion
-   **Bancolombia (Our Bank):** Bancolombia is Colombia’s largest bank, boasting 146+ years of trusted service. ### Meet our first customer

[![](https://i.ibb.co/sd0gp7sF/Screenshot-2025-02-25-at-17-02-55.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzP1vXJq7zQ&t=2714s&ab_channel=TheKus)

we introduced CocoWallet, building on the success of [CocoMercado](https://www.cocomercado.com/landing/), a remittance-based food service that’s supported Venezuela’s elderly through 7,000,000 expats. -   **Kusama Benefits:** These 3,000 new users will become KSM holders, boosting adoption. Each card swipe will generate on-chain micro-transactions, increasing network activity and rewarding validators.
-   **Scalability:** After this pilot, we’ll scale to 10,000 users across Latin America by 2025, funded by transaction fees but no endless treasury asks. Banks are obsolete. When a transaction is authorized, the two parts are combined to complete the transaction.
    
-   **How are redemptions processed?**  
    Today’s redemption channels include Brale Rails (conversion across 10+ chains to USDT/USDC), a DEX liquidity pool for KSM/dUSD, and direct debit card transactions.
    
-   **Do day-to-day COP inflation swings pose a risk?**  
    Yes, they can. To mitigate this risk, we maintain only small COP buffers in the bank while holding most of our treasury in USD.
    
-   **How will the system mitigate potential volatility given that settlement can take several days?**  
    Limiting USD buffer sales to twice daily (e.g., morning and afternoon) may expose us to unexpected volatility. Ideally, we offload USD as frequently as market conditions allow. When that isn’t feasible, we rely on compensation accounts, short-term COP buffer loans, SWIFT transfers, and OTC channels to quickly convert USD into COP liquidity.
    
-   **How would a chargeback or clawback be handled?**  
    **_For same-day chargebacks_**—such as paying $5 with KSM for an Uber ride and then canceling—the system applies an adjustment credit by deducting $5 from the USD buffer, converting it to KSM, and crediting your account. **_For delayed clawbacks_**—like purchasing a $20 card with KSM on Temu but receiving a faulty product—we detect the issue via Visa’s invoices and balance sheets. In the next payment cycle, we net the amounts between our accounts; for instance, if we owe Visa $100 but receive $20, we pay only $80, converting the extra $20 into KSM and crediting your account.
    
-   **Whats the relationship with Virto?** BloqueDAO is a Virto-spinoff established as a self-governing DAO in Kreivo. We’re leveraging on the Kreivo technology to support non-custodial management of the funds every user tops-up in their Kusama Pay cards.

**Requested:** 120.7K USD \* 4.36% (buffer price) (19.9 KSM/USD — EMA7) = **6,331** KSM

## TL;TR

This is 3 minutes summary for the proposal, part of our pitch in 17/02 AGG [![Agg pitch](https://i.ibb.co/nMLC54XG/Screenshot-2025-02-17-at-15-15-39.png)](https://www.youtube.com/live/kBX1RXwROy8?si=G1T9ymPBgJIUZ7Tf&t=454) [here the slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Er3hN0vcroGM83XNQTvjVCn21-jD47S7rSoFQwYXhi4/edit?usp=sharing)

## **Why?**

Today, issue debit cards for web3 projects is process that involves huge investments, strict compliance requirements and operational overhead that couldn't be paid by many developers.

We're building an Open API to issue debit cards and then build financial bridges for everyday use cases on Kusama (for example, paying for your lunch or sending money to your loved ones); think of it as a web3 Stripe powered by Kusama.

Holders, consider this: an increase in volume on the Kusama chain will eventually create demand for the token, driving up hopefully prices.

## What?

We provide all the operational, development, and financial team expertise to provide a compliant, non-custodial card infrastructure for Kusama users.

You can expect us to deliver:

-   **First stage (this proposal)**: Launch a developer-friendly API to enable Kusama apps to launch prepaid debit cards as easily as with one line of code.

## How it works?

![](https://i.ibb.co/CKsh6Y4F/diagram-export-2-17-2025-2-58-28-PM.png)

## Our Partners

-   **Pomelo + Visa (Debit card issuer):** Pomelo is a pioneering fintech transforming card issuance in Latin America. Its cloud-native, API-driven platform lets banks and fintechs launch secure, scalable cards rapidly. Partnering with Mastercard and Coastal Community Bank, Pomelo modernizes payments and drives financial inclusion.
-   **Truora (KYC/KYB):** Truora is a Latin American startup simplifying user verification and fraud prevention. Its API-driven platform offers background checks, digital identity, and KYC tools to help businesses onboard customers securely, reduce fraud, and boost conversion
-   **Bancolombia (Our Bank):** Bancolombia is Colombia’s largest bank, boasting 146+ years of trusted service. With 30M+ customers, extensive branch and ATM networks, and innovative digital solutions, it drives financial inclusion, supports sustainable growth, and champions economic progress across Latin America.

## Documentation

-   [API Documentation:](https://api.bloque.app/docs/accounts) here you will find a preview in how it will work, you can create your own identities and also cards, if you want to test it please contact us.

### Card Features

-   Funds are non-custodial in Asset-hub.
-   Top-up via dUSD via Polygon, Etherium, Asset-hub + 10+ chains.
-   You can add this card to Apple or Google Wallet.
-   Worldwide shipping for Physical Card.
-   Cash ATM withdraws.
-   As developer you can issue debit cards and earn up to ~1.3% from customers purchases cheaper, compliant and easier than ever before.

### Benefits for Kusama

-   All balances for the debit cards would be on-chain, ensuring transparency and increased chain volume.
-   Calling all developers and builders! We're taking Kusama to new heights by partnering with more real world startups.
-   Visa provides card infrastructure via Pomelo ([https://pomelo.la/es/](https://pomelo.la/es/)).
    -   Our agreement with Pomelo is established in Colombia, but you can get access to the card worldwide (you only need a passport to verify your identity).
-   Today, we want to support dUSD and KSM via Asset Conversions in Asset Hub.
    -   In the future, we’ll be able to enable other coins/tokens created in the ecosystem to be used in daily use cases. For example, you could make a token in Asset Hub, create a pool (`YOUR_TOKEN/dUSD`), and then use that token to pay for your bus ticket.
    -   With our customers and operation only, we will increase the volume on chain by ~700K USD monthly

## How is it different from Polkadot Pay, Polkadot App or Nova Wallet debit card?

Actually, we're not competing —we're here to enable innovation. Think of us as an open API for debit card issuance for web3 projects, helping more projects/wallets/dapps to connect their users with their money. Here's what that means:

-   **Integration Made Simple:** Our platform lets dapps and apps add debit card functionality without the heavy investments or operational overhead.
-   **Building Together:** Instead of competing, we empower services to enhance their offerings. We provide the foundation, and you build on top of it.
-   **Expanding Regional Reach:** We also support regional growth. For instance, if Polkadot Pay or Nova wants to extend their services into new regions like Latin America, our solution can simplify and accelerate that process.

In short, we're not here to replace existing services—we're here to support and enhance them. Our focus is on making it easier for any platform to offer debit cards, thereby driving innovation and growth across the board.

[Here, If you want a more detailed comparison](https://docs.google.com/document/d/17uaTkqpwEgpUgVkM62S1K3YA4enlchwAciX3ni_jF7Y/edit?usp=sharing)

## How far are we?

We have been working on the relationships and legal requirements to launch these debit cards for over a year; today, we’re in an advanced integration process for friends and family and with the regulatory requirements to do it.

## **About us**

-   [David Barinas:](https://www.linkedin.com/in/davidbarinas/) CEO + Sr Engineer - Former YCombinator S19 Founder (Valiu 300K users + 6.2M raised).
-   [Ole Tobias:](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ole-tobias-lode/) COO + Product Managment - MSc in Technology Management, former Technology Consultant at Deloitte, and ex-COO of Efficence AS.
-   [Roy Parrish:](https://www.linkedin.com/in/roy-parrish-rippe/) Chief Legal Officer - LATAM & North America | Strategic Oversight of Compliance and Regulatory Affairs
-   [Katherin Lopez:](https://www.linkedin.com/in/angy-katherine-l%C3%B3pez-pr/) Head of User Research and Deals seeker / Ex Littio (YCS19) Ex Valiu (YCS19).
-   [Luis Polania:](https://www.linkedin.com/in/luis-%C3%A1ngel-c%C3%B3rdoba-polan%C3%ADa-a1175a190/) / Head of Financial Operations Ex Littio (YCS23) Ex Valiu (YCS19).

### Traction

-   Today, our monthly volume is ~253K USD, which we plan to migrate to Kusama via dUSD.
-   Startups will work with us until today:
    -   [Coco Wallet YCS19](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/coco-wallet) 3.5K Users monthly [Link to LoI](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yOyvpNZvc043MvF61o6oppkY9rJ0gsqB/view?usp=sharing)
    -   New Customers will be released and updated here soon…

## Expenses Breakdown

-   **45.7K USD** License = **30K USD x 19% Colombian VAT + 10K USD Collateral for Visa**
-   **75K USD = 2.5K USD x 5 Members Full time x 6 Months**

**Total:** 120.7K USD

## Discussion Channel & Website

If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us on our channel to discuss them with the community.

-   [Join here](https://matrix.to/#/#kusama-pay:bloque.team)
-   [Bloque Landing](https://www.bloque.app)

## FAQ

-   **Why funding us?**

We are an experienced team with a proven record of building Web3 products. Now, we want to use Kusama in everyday cases worldwide.

-   **Which regions are excluded?**
    
    Due to Visa terms and conditions, the following regions are excluded.
    
    -   Afghanistan
    -   Albania
    -   Belarus (Republic of Belarus)
    -   Bosnia & Herzegovina
    -   Burundi
    -   Cambodia
    -   Cameroon
    -   Central African Rep
    -   Congo (the Democratic Republic of the)
    -   Congo (the)
    -   Croatia
    -   Cuba (Republic of Cuba)
    -   Eritrea
    -   Hait
    -   Iran (Islamic Republic of Iran)
    -   Ira
    -   Lebanon
    -   Liberia
    -   **Libya**
    -   Mali
    -   Mozambique
    -   Myanmar (Burma)
    -   Nicaragua
    -   Nigeria
    -   North Korea (DPRK - Democratic People’s Republic of Korea)
    -   Pakistan
    -   Palestine (State of)
    -   Philippines
    -   Russia (Russian Federation)
    -   Somalia
    -   South Sudan
    -   Sudan (the)
    -   Syria (Syrian Arab Republic)
    -   Yemen
    -   Zimbabwe
-   **Why is the web app in the second stage?**
    
    What’s cool about having our open API for Kusama Apps first is that other teams in the ecosystem can create frontends. These could be part of Nova Wallet or external web apps, for example. We want to be enablers for the whole ecosystem, this must be a different discussion!
    
-   **Whats the relationship with Virto?**
    

BloqueDAO is a Virto-spinoff established as a self-governing DAO in Kreivo. We’re leveraging on the Kreivo technology to support non-custodial management of the funds every user tops-up in their Kusama Pay cards.

-   **Would you be open to having your license or partnerships verified?**

We're open to being independently verified by any member of Kusama. However, because our documents include non-disclosure agreements, we cannot share them publicly, though we can provide them privately.

items.title: Kusama Hydration: Treasury LP
items.content:
**Requested Amount:** 33,333 KSM

**Date (Discussion):** 21-01-25

**Short Description:** Strengthen KSM on-chain liquidity by providing 33,333 KSM as liquidity into the Hydration Omnipool -  opening up value flows between Kusama and Polkadot. The funds remain under the control of the Kusama Protocol and OpenGov after successfully launching KSM trading on Hydration.

**Please read the full proposal [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wZnqrjTAQsZXVZpJk8tUQ6G-XsSwgsOUtwji_cn0nk0/edit?usp=sharing).**

# Summary
The goal of this proposal is to contribute towards building an accessible, deep layer of native liquidity on Polkadot and connecting that with Kusama - encouraging value flows between the sister chains without the need for a centralised intermediary.

If approved, this proposal will provide 33,333 KSM from the Kusama Treasury into the Hydration Omnipool - after KSM is launched for swaps on Hydration, the liquidity position will remain under the control of the Kusama Protocol and OpenGov.

The requested KSM would be added to the Omnipool as single-sided liquidity, in the same way that [1,000,000 DOT were added through ref #560](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/560) - this would be the most liquid trading venue for KSM on Polkadot and finally provide a simple and trustless way to move value between Polkadot and Kusama. No more hops on CEX required to make the move!

items.title: Prestel & Partners: Family Office Investor Conference Series for Polkadot & Kusama.
items.content:
This proposal aims to obtain a budget to sponsor a series of 5 global Family Office (FO) summits, with the goal of bringing more external capital to **Polkadot and Kusama.** It should be noted that this Kusama OpenGov proposal is following a [failed](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1337) proposal of similar scope to Polkadot OpenGov. If this one is successful now, we pledge to pivot HIC’s investment scope to also include Kusama-focused projects.

In discussion with active members of the community we believe that Kusama’s ecosystem offers an underappreciated investment opportunity, a differentiated culture focused on artists, hackers and innovators and a great place to uncover experimental projects advancing Polkadot’s pioneering technology stack. This proposal would seek to channel new investments into the ecosystem, and make more funding available for teams building on Kusama.

Although development progress has been quieter in the canary compared to its cousin Polkadot, a number of recent developments including [Virto’s](https://virto.network/) evolving organisational and payments infrastructure, [Brale’s](https://brale.xyz) regulated stablecoin integration and the launch of the community focused decent/dUSD stablecoin (#[471](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/471) and #[474](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/474)) that recirculates yield into the ecosystem, representing exciting foundations that have the potential to unlock new investment opportunities.

**Key Kusama Amendments**

If this proposal passes, HIC Fund II will make the following three key pivots to Kusama:

-   HIC Fund II will open its investment scope to also include Kusama-focused projects in addition to those building on Polkadot.
-   HIC will establish a Krievo DAO to operate as an investment advisory committee providing the fund with domain experts, supporting invested entities and sourcing talent and projects\*
-   HIC will use dUSD as a stablecoin for investments and on its balance sheet.

_\*HIC DAO would act as a non-binding advisory body sourcing and pre-screening investment proposals, with the fund's GPs making the final investment decision._

We are also including an additional line in the budget for filming around the London event which we believe is key to communicating the work to token holders and for creating useful collateral for marketing the fund to investors as part of a follow-up strategy beyond attendees of the events.

**Event Series**

This proposal will focus on 5 global family office (FO) summits, which is where we see the greatest opportunity for bringing untapped capital into Polkadot and Kusama. The summit host, Prestel & Partner, has been chosen as a well established and reputable organiser of such investment conferences. The conference series would be organised by Harbour Industrial Capital on behalf of Polkadot and Kusama and take place in Singapore, Istanbul, London, Zurich and Riyadh between April and December 2025.

The full proposal can be found here: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/12TkwJTO5ezD3jg8jjRx1-MJJ91VwnzBLdGvTwI9dPPc/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12TkwJTO5ezD3jg8jjRx1-MJJ91VwnzBLdGvTwI9dPPc/edit?usp=sharing)
